preqs: For students who commenced their LLB (Hons) course in 2015 or later: LAW1111; LAW1114; LAW2101 and LAW2112For students who commenced their LLB course prior to 2015: LAW1100 OR LAW1101 and LAW1102 or LAW1104; LAW2101

rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {LAW2101}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {1074} Do Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000567} Otherwise true
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {L3%} Do Any co-req (I/W) unit in {LAW1101, LAW1102, LAW1104} Otherwise true

proh: For students who commenced their LLB course prior to 2015: LAW2100
description: Contract law addresses the concepts, principles and rules used to determine the existence and content of binding promises and their enforcement or defeasibility in a market economy. It also addresses the underlying policy considerations. Contract B builds upon Contract A, which covers the formation and terms of a contract. Contract B covers the performance of contracts, the discharge of contracts by termination or frustration, legal and equitable remedies for breach of contract, and vitiating factors under the unwritten law and statute.
